turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: hi, good evening

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Hi how are you

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: i'm great, thank you. are you involved in any charities?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Only in our church missionaries

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: thats great! have you ever heard of save the children?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No i have not. What is that about?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: its a great international organization that promotes childrens right, provides relief, and helps support children in developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Oh thats pretty neat. Does it help american children also

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: it does! it helps with their rights to healthcare, education, and safety. it really is so beneficial.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: There is such a need for things involving kids now days.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: very true, we really are all they have when they have inadequate resources at home. would you be interested in donating a portion of your task earnings tonight?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Thank you for asking me, but at this time i am going to say no. I would need to research this organization and discuss it with my husband so we can make all decisions together

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: that is understandable. you can tell him how great and professional the save the children organization is. they have great credentials and large international impact. your money would not be wasted.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Thank you for the information but we dont make decisions quickly. We have a large family and we like to be as informed as possible and then discuss it and go from there. All decisions are as important to us as buying a home

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: that's a great way to be. its a large decision for the syrian children's parents too to when it comes to keeping their children safe on the limited resources they have. all adults have to make tough choices. are you sure you wouldn't like to donate anything from $0 to $2? anything at all helps.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I understandnthat but it would be against our household rules to do anything without discussing it.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm sure there's some money you would spend on a snack or candy tomorrow that could be given to the needy children instead. even that small of a donation can help numerous children.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I am sorry but you are wrong. We buy groceries once a month on a very tight budget. With 7kids and 1 income every penny counts to just get by. We budget and pray about every decision

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I would be more than happy to match even a .01 donation from you tonight.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Again thank you but it would be a bad example to my own family to make any rash decisions without soeakimg to my husband who is thr head of our household
